answers.answer: Hello,Testicular numbness can be due to operation, nerve damage, due to infection - gonorrhoea, chlamydia etc, diabetes,thyroid disease or kidney stones.You should consult your doctor to rule out the above causes and find out the further management plan in your case.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: Hello everyone. About a week ago, I smoked marijuana everyday for 5 days. I am a 19 year old male. I had my left testicle surgically removed at age 8 due to a torsion. A thing about me after I smoke marijuana is that I feel numb all around my body, especially my testicle. Right now, I still don't feel that I have recovered the full sensation of my right testicle. I can feel the testicle when I touch it (some parts less than the other). However, I don't feel it hanging down like I used to. Might be all in my head, but might be not. I went to a GP, he said that the testicle looks fine, but that he would refer me to a urologist if I wanted him to. Anyone have any idea what's wrong with me?
title: Testicle slightly numb
